titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Albert C. Wedemeyer papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rebecca J. Mead

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-19T14:02-0700

change.item: Photographs removed from photo file and album shelf and rehoused in boxes 153-163 by Beth Goder.
Revised to add incremental materials box by Liz Phillips.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi.
Added photograph information from photo card catalog.

PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Albert C. (Albert Coady) Wedemeyer Papers )//EN" "reg_094.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 148 manuscript boxes, 1 card file box, 14 oversize boxes, 2 motion picture film reels, 19 sound discs, 1 sound cassette, 2 maps, memorabilia

did.abstract: Orders, plans, memoranda, reports, correspondence, speeches and writings, clippings, printed matter, photographs, and memorabilia relating to Allied strategic planning during World War II, military operations in China, American foreign policy in China, and post-war American politics and foreign relations.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some sound recordings in the collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Albert C. Wedemeyer papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1983, with increments received in later years.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Omaha, Nebraska
Commissioned Second Lieutenant, U. S. Army
Graduated from United States Military Academy, West Point, New York
Assigned to Infantry School and 29th Infantry, Fort Benning, Georgia
Promoted to First Lieutenant
Aide-de-Camp to Brigadier General Paul B. Malone at Fort Benning, Georgia, Fort Sill, Oklahoma, and Fort Sam Houston, Texas
Served with the 31st Infantry and 57th Infantry, Philippine Islands
Assigned to 12th Infantry, Fort Washington, Maryland
Aide-de-Camp to Commanding General, District of Washington
Served with 15th Infantry, Tientsin, China
Aide-de-Camp to Major General C. E. Kilbourne, Corregidor, Philippine Islands
Attended the Command and General Staff School, Fort Leavenworth, Kansas
Promoted to Captain
Student officer, German War College, Berlin, Germany
Assigned to 29th Infantry, Fort Benning, Georgia
Promoted to Major
Assigned to Training Section, Office of the Chief of Infantry
Promoted to Lieutenant Colonel (temporary) Staff member, War Plans Division, War Department General
Promoted to Colonel (temporary), Brigadier General (temporary), and Lieutenant Colonel (permanent) Chief, Strategy and Policy Section, Operations Division, War Department
Promoted to Major General (temporary)
Deputy Chief of Staff to Admiral Mountbatten, Combined Anglo-American South East Asia Command

eventgrp.event: Commanding General, United States Forces, China Theatre
Chief of Staff to Chiang Kai-shek

chronitem.event: Promoted to Lieutenant General (temporary)
Promoted to Brigadier General (permanent)
Commanding General, Second Army, Baltimore, Maryland
Special Envoy to China and Korea
Director, Plans and Operations Division, General Staff, United States Army
Deputy Chief of Staff for Plans and Combat Operations
Commanding General, Sixth Army, San Francisco, California
Retired with rank of Lieutenant General
Executive Vice President, AVCO Manufacturing Corporation
Chairman, National Citizens for Taft
Promoted to General on retired list
Executive Vice President, Rheem Manufacturing Company
Author, Wedemeyer Reports!
Author, Wedemeyer on War and Peace (edited by Keith Eiler)
Died, Fort Belvoir, Virginia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Orders, plans, memoranda, reports, correspondence, speeches and writings, clippings, printed matter, photographs, and memorabilia relating to Allied strategic planning during World War II, military operations in China, American foreign policy in China, and post-war American politics and foreign relations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes, memoranda, biographical sketches, itineraries, clippings, correspondence, legal documents, certificates, printed material, poems, resolutions, lists, speeches, newsletters, pamphlets, programs, and miscellany, arranged alphabetically by form.
